required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Covered Versus Uncovered Biliary Stents for Biliary Malignancies
clinical_study.official_title: Covered Versus Uncovered Metal Stents for Biliary Malignancies - A Randomized Controlled Trial

oversight_info.authority: Italy: National Monitoring Centre for Clinical Trials - Ministry of Health

brief_summary.textblock: Patency duration of covered metal stents as compared with uncovered metal stents in the management of malignant strictures of the extra-hepatic biliary tree.

detailed_description.textblock: Consecutive patients with malignant strictures of the extra-hepatic biliary tree considered unfit for surgical excision Placement of covered or uncovered metal stents in patients with and without gallbladder on the basis of a computer-generated randomization list Evaluation of clinical outcome, survival, complications, and quality of life. Evaluation of the cost and efficacy of the two types of metal stents.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

secondary_outcome.description: cost and effectiveness of covered versus uncovered biliary stents

other_outcome.description: Acute cholecystitis could affect the clinical outcome of patients when a covered stent is used

arm_group.description: endoscopic placement of covered biliary stents
endoscopic placement of uncovered biliary stents

intervention.description: endoscopic placement of covered biliary stents
endoscopic placement of uncovered biliary stents

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult patients with symptomatic malignant obstruction of the extra-hepatic biliary tree
- not eligible for surgical intervention
- able to provide informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- benign biliary obstruction
- previous surgery of the biliary tract
- life expectancy < 3 months

reference.citation: Isayama H, Nakai Y, Kogure H, Yamamoto N, Koike K. Biliary self-expandable metallic stent for unresectable malignant distal biliary obstruction: which is better: covered or uncovered? Dig Endosc. 2013 May;25 Suppl 2:71-4. doi: 10.1111/den.12078. Review.

clinical_study.keyword: distal malignancy of the extra-hepatic biliary tract
